column4: Hey, I have a Toshiba Satellite L305-S5921, and have Natty installed... and I just had a very messed up system failure.... my laptop just overheated with no apparent cause...
I opened it up, checked all the cables, and everything seemed in order, the fan is running properly, etc...
Any ideas as to what might have caused the issue?
Not at all, actually, and then twice this morning alone.
you may want to test the hard drive temps
sudo apt-get install  hddtemp
it doens have to be started at boot so ignor that prompt
I'll check that out.
if you want to test temps in   celcius   the command is   sudo hddtemp /dev/sd*   i fyou want farenheit it is  sudo  hddtemp --u=F  /dev/sd*
I ran said prog.... 102F is my current reading
whoa ,, that's way too hot
80 F  or  83 F should be the ceiling
shut it down,, let it cool off ,, then restart and see if the temps increase again
if it gets beyong 90 F  shut it down again
otherwise you will get termal damage and the drive will fall into read only mode
still too hot
for a video card that is reasonable temp not for hard drives
you dont want to drive to get too much termal damage,, as i said it will fall into read only mode then you could be looking at a new hard drive
terminal damage makes a drive unreliable
another thing to try is install an earlier version of ubuntu ,, see if the temps continue to rise
however here,, 11.04.. the only thing I noticed is increase in ram useage not much in temps of hard drive or video card
